name: Oracle Database 19c
description: Oracle Database 19c is the current long term support version of the Oracle Database, offering high performance, reliability, security, and scalability for mission-critical applications.
useCase: Enterprise data management, high-performance OLTP and OLAP workloads, mission-critical applications requiring high availability.
limitations: High licensing costs, complex administration, resource intensive.
securityConsiderations: Regular patching required, secure configuration best practices must be followed, privileged access management required.
costConsiderations: Licensing is based on processor cores or named users, additional costs for Enterprise Edition features.
complianceRequirements: Quarterly patch updates recommended, support lifecycle policies apply.

additionalVersions.notes: Previous generation database with reduced support
Next generation database with enhanced features in development

name: Oracle WebLogic Server
description: Oracle WebLogic Server is a Java EE application server providing a platform for developing and deploying enterprise Java applications.
useCase: Enterprise Java applications, microservices, cloud native applications with Java backend.
limitations: Performance overhead for small applications, complex administration for clustering.
alternatives: JBoss EAP, Apache Tomcat, IBM WebSphere
securityConsiderations: Regular security patching required, secure default configurations, application security scanning.
costConsiderations: Per-processor or per-user licensing, additional costs for management packs.
complianceRequirements: Regular security patches, certified configurations for production use.

name: Red Hat Enterprise Linux
description: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) is a Linux distribution developed by Red Hat for the commercial market, designed for stability, security, and long-term support.
useCase: Enterprise server environments, cloud infrastructure, virtualization hosts, application servers.
limitations: Commercial licensing required, not suited for desktop usage.
alternatives: CentOS, Ubuntu Server, SUSE Linux Enterprise Server
securityConsiderations: Regular security updates, SELinux for enhanced security, vulnerability management.
costConsiderations: Subscription-based licensing per physical or virtual instance.
complianceRequirements: Regular patching required, compliance with security advisories.

name: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform
description: Red Hat OpenShift is an enterprise Kubernetes container platform with full-stack automated operations to manage hybrid cloud, multi-cloud, and edge deployments.
useCase: Enterprise container orchestration, microservices architecture, DevOps automation, cloud-native applications.
limitations: Significant resource requirements, complex initial setup, enterprise pricing.
alternatives: Kubernetes, Rancher, Google Kubernetes Engine, Amazon EKS
securityConsiderations: Container security scanning, network segmentation, RBAC implementation, image signing.
costConsiderations: Subscription-based pricing per core or per node, infrastructure costs.
complianceRequirements: Regular updates for CVE patching, security-focused configurations.

name: Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform
description: JBoss EAP is an open-source platform for Java applications, offering high availability clustering, messaging, and distributed caching.
useCase: Enterprise Java applications, microservices with Java backend, traditional Java EE workloads.
limitations: Complexity for simple applications, requires Java expertise.
alternatives: Oracle WebLogic, Apache Tomcat, IBM WebSphere
securityConsiderations: Regular patching, secure configuration best practices, application security scanning.
costConsiderations: Subscription-based, priced per core pair with premium support options.
complianceRequirements: Regular security updates, certified configurations for production.

name: VMware vSphere
description: VMware vSphere is a server virtualization platform that transforms physical resources into pools of virtual resources for running multiple workloads in virtual machines.
useCase: Server consolidation, data center virtualization, disaster recovery, hybrid cloud infrastructure.
limitations: High licensing costs, complex management for large environments.
securityConsiderations: VM isolation, secure hypervisor configuration, network segmentation, regular patching.
costConsiderations: Per-processor licensing with core restrictions, additional costs for management and advanced features.
complianceRequirements: Regular security patches, maintaining supported configurations.

name: VMware NSX Data Center
description: VMware NSX Data Center is a network virtualization platform that enables the virtual cloud network, providing networking and security services in software.
useCase: Network virtualization, micro-segmentation, security policy automation, software-defined networking.
limitations: Complex implementation, requires specialized skills, significant investment.
alternatives: Cisco ACI, Juniper Contrail, Open vSwitch
securityConsiderations: Micro-segmentation policies, distributed firewall rules, intrusion detection/prevention.
costConsiderations: Per-processor or per-VM licensing, additional professional services often needed.
complianceRequirements: Regular security updates, compliance with networking standards.

name: VMware Horizon
description: VMware Horizon is a virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) platform that delivers virtualized or remote desktops and applications through a single platform.
useCase: Remote work enablement, secure desktop delivery, desktop-as-a-service, bring-your-own-device support.
limitations: High infrastructure requirements, complex setup, bandwidth considerations.
alternatives: Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops, Microsoft AVD, Amazon WorkSpaces
securityConsiderations: Image management security, endpoint security, access controls, multi-factor authentication.
costConsiderations: Per-named or concurrent user licensing, infrastructure costs, management overhead.
complianceRequirements: Regular patching, security updates, compliance with desktop security policies.

name: Oracle Java SE
description: Oracle Java SE is a development and deployment platform for portable code for desktop and server environments.
useCase: Enterprise applications, cross-platform development, server-side applications.
limitations: Commercial licensing for production use, version compatibility considerations.
alternatives: OpenJDK, Amazon Corretto, Microsoft Build of OpenJDK
securityConsiderations: Regular security updates, code scanning, secure coding practices.
costConsiderations: Per-processor or per-user licensing for production use, free for development.

name: Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform
description: Ansible Automation Platform is an IT automation solution for configuration management, application deployment, and orchestration.
useCase: Infrastructure automation, configuration management, application deployment, security automation.
limitations: Learning curve for complex playbooks, idempotency considerations.
securityConsiderations: Role-based access control, credential management, secure playbook development.

name: MongoDB
description: MongoDB is a document-oriented NoSQL database used for high-volume data storage and complex applications. It uses JSON-like documents with schema.
useCase: Real-time analytics, content management, IoT applications, and mobile applications requiring flexible schema design.
limitations: Not ideal for complex transactions requiring ACID properties across multiple operations or documents without additional configuration.
securityConsiderations: Requires proper authentication, authorization, and network security configuration. Default installations should be secured against unauthorized access.
costConsiderations: Open source Community Edition available, Enterprise versions require subscription.
complianceRequirements: Enterprise Advanced version offers HIPAA, PCI DSS, and SOC compliance features.

additionalVersions.notes: Previous stable version with time series and sharding enhancements
